Description: Bowl. 8 rows of eye-like ellipses with discs. Made of cream slipware and glazed pottery (red).
Curator's comments: Bowl painted in coloured slips with a peacock feather motif under a colourless glaze Nishapur, Iran, 10th century
Bibliographic references: Lane 1947 / Early Islamic Pottery: Mesopotamia, Egypt and Persia (fig.18.B)
Pinder-Wilson 1976b / Oriental Ceramics, the world's great collections: the British Museum (fig.284)
Pézard 1920 / La céramique archaïque de l'Islam et ses origines (pl.xcviii.1)
Barrett 1950 / The Raphael Bequest II Oriental Antiquities Persian Pottery (p.93)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2012-2013 24 Nov-13 Jan, Indianapolis Museum of Art, Beauty and Belief 2012 24 Feb-29 Sep, Provo, Brigham Young University Museum of Art, Beauty and Belief 2007 14 Sep-2 Dec, Hong Kong Museum of Art, Treasures of the World's Cultures 2007 3 Feb-27 May, Taipei, National Palace Museum, Treasures of the World's Cultures
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Jacques Doucet (his sale, 28 Nov. 1930, lot 77, pl. xxvi)
